text: 200px|thumb|Shimo Village was a village located in Imizu District, Toyama Prefecture, Japan. As of 2003, the village had an estimated population of 2,065 and a density of 356.03 persons per km². The total area was 5.80 km². On November 1, 2005 Shimo, along with the city of Shinminato, and the towns of Daimon, Kosugi and Ōshima (all from Imizu District), was merged to create the city of Imizu and no longer exists as an independent municipality. Category:Dissolved municipalities of Toyama Prefecture Category:Imizu, Toyama
title: Shimo, Toyama
